title: Quiz 2: Water and Sanitation
description: Evaluate your knowledge on water sources, purification methods, and waste disposal systems.

questions.question: Which of the following diseases is classified as 'water-washed' due to scarcity of water for hygiene?
questions.explanation: Scabies is a water-washed disease caused by poor personal hygiene resulting from a lack of adequate water.
questions.hint: Think of diseases prevented by washing.

questions.question: For household water treatment, chlorine should be in contact with water for at least ___BLANK___ minutes before consumption.
questions.explanation: A minimum contact time of 30 minutes is required for chlorine to effectively kill pathogens in water.

questions.question: Match the water-related disease category with its description:

pairs.right: Caused by lack of water for hygiene

questions.explanation: Water-borne (e.g., Cholera); Water-washed (e.g., Scabies); Water-related (e.g., Malaria).
questions.hint: Borne = drink; Washed = hygiene; Related = vector.

questions.question: Select all correct methods for protecting a spring water source:

options.text: Building a retaining wall around the 'eye'
Digging a diversion drain for surface water
Fencing the area to keep animals away
Allowing animals to drink directly from the source

questions.explanation: Protection involves fencing, drainage diversion, and structural walls. Animals and settlement contaminate the source.

questions.question: Arrange the steps of the '4F Connection' transmission route:
questions.explanation: Pathogens travel from Faeces -> via Flies/Fingers -> to Food -> to the Host.
questions.hint: Start with the source of infection.

questions.question: Which type of latrine is most suitable for temporary use, such as in emergency camps?
questions.explanation: Trench latrines are quick to dig and suitable for short-term, high-density use like camps.
questions.hint: It involves digging a long ditch.

questions.question: What is the biological process used in composting where micro-organisms break down organic matter?
questions.explanation: Composting relies on aerobic decomposition by micro-organisms to turn waste into humus.

questions.question: Review the waste disposal methods. Which method is BEST suited for non-biodegradable waste like glass and plastic?

richContent.content:
Waste Types

  • Type A: Food scraps, leaves
  • Type B: Glass bottles, plastic containers
  • Type C: Medical sharps

questions.explanation: Recycling is the appropriate method for non-biodegradable materials like glass and plastic that can be reprocessed.

questions.question: Rainwater harvested from a thatched roof is considered the cleanest natural water source.
questions.explanation: False. Thatched roofs are difficult to clean and may contaminate water with dust, insects, and organic matter. Clean iron sheets are preferred.
questions.hint: Think about what might fall from grass roofs.

questions.question: Why should a pit latrine be located at least 6 meters away from a house?
questions.explanation: Distance helps minimize foul odors and nuisance flies reaching the living area.
